meanings.definition: Resembling sugar in taste or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The cake had a sugarlike frosting that sparkled in the light.
meanings.sent2: Her smile was as sugarlike as the sweetest candy.
meanings.sent3: The sugarlike clouds in the sky looked good enough to eat.
meanings.sent4: The sugarlike snow glistened under the winter sun.
meanings.sent5: The sugarlike crystals on the cookies made them irresistible.

meanings.sent1: The fruit had a sugarlike sweetness that made it a favorite treat.
meanings.sent2: His voice had a sugarlike quality that was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent3: The sugarlike softness of the kitten's fur was comforting to touch.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as sugarlike as a melody in the air.
meanings.sent5: The sugarlike aroma of the flowers filled the room with a delightful scent.

meanings.sent1: The dessert was so sugarlike that it melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent2: The tea had a sugarlike sweetness that warmed me from the inside.
meanings.sent3: His jokes were as sugarlike as the candy he always carried.
meanings.sent4: The sugarlike flavor of the fruit juice was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The sugarlike syrup on the pancakes made them a delicious breakfast choice.
